Also, in Fortran, array indexes start at 1 by default, but we declared freq as 0:255, which is okay. So the full code:

program codeforces_276_B

    implicit none

    character(len=200) :: s
    integer, dimension(0:255) :: freq
    integer :: i, code, odd_count

    ! Initialize frequency array to 0
    freq = 0

    !
children.label: code_analysis

children.text:
Read the input
    read(*, '(A)') s

    ! Compute frequencies
    do i =1, len_trim(s)
        ! Get current character
        code = ichar( s(i:i) )
        freq(code) = freq(code) +1
    end do

    odd_count =0
    do i =0,255
        if (mod(freq(i),2)/=0) then
            odd_count = odd_count +1
        end if
    end do

    ! Check condition and output
    if ( (odd_count <=1) .or. (mod(odd_count, 2)/=0) ) then
        write(*,*) 'First'
    else
        write(*,*) 'Second'
    end if

end program codeforces_276_B

Wait, but when odd_count is less than or equal to 1, it's possible to have 0 or 1. 0 is even, 1 is odd. So combining these OR, it covers:

- If there are even counts (zero odd counts → condition met), so first.

- If there's one odd count → condition is met, first.

- Or if there are multiple but odd number of odd counts (like 3,5 etc.), then also first.

program codeforces_276_B

    implicit none

    character(len=200) :: s
    integer, dimension(0:255) :: freq
    integer :: i, code, odd_count

        code = ichar( s(i:i) )
        freq(code) = freq(code) +1
    end do

    odd_count =0
    do i =0,255
        if (mod(freq(i),2)/=0) then
            odd_count = odd_count +1
        end if
    end do

    ! Check condition and output
    if ( (odd_count <=1) .or. (mod(odd_count, 2)/=0) ) then
        write(*,*) 'First'
    else
        write(*,*) 'Second'
    end if

end program codeforces_276_B
